prompts.content:
I need you to analyze PR #1423 review comments and provide a comprehensive autonomous review. This PR implements a Slash Commands MCP Server with file consolidation.

CONTEXT:
- PR: https://github.com/jleechanorg/worldarchitect.ai/pull/1423
- Branch: cmd_mcp  
- Key Changes: Consolidated 29 MCP tool files into unified router, applied file placement protocol
- Status: Tests passing, 314 review comments, merge ready pending fixes

YOUR TASK:
1. Get all recent PR review comments from August 22nd onwards
2. Categorize issues by: Critical/Security, Architecture, Code Quality, Documentation
3. Focus on patterns that appear in multiple comments vs one-off issues
4. Identify any blocking issues vs nice-to-have improvements
5. Provide specific fixes for the most critical 5-10 issues
6. Generate autonomous PR comment addressing findings

AUTONOMOUS COPILOT PROTOCOL:
- Operate autonomously without approval prompts (analysis only)  
- Continue through conflicts, issues, or blockers
- Apply fixes automatically where possible
- Must NOT trigger any merge operations (analysis only)
- Focus on correctness and code quality per user requirements

Use GitHub MCP tools to analyze the PR comprehensively. Examine the changes, understand the consolidation architecture, and provide actionable feedback.

prompts.content:
Perform a comprehensive code review of PR #1423 (https://github.com/jleechanorg/worldarchitect.ai/pull/1423) focusing on the MCP server implementation:

## Review Focus Areas:

### 1. Architectural Correctness
- Verify the thin proxy pattern is correctly implemented
- Ensure proxy tools return instructions, not execute logic
- Validate script execution tools properly call underlying scripts
- Check MCP protocol compliance

### 2. Code Quality
- Python best practices and idioms
- Error handling completeness
- Security considerations (subprocess execution, input validation)
- Performance implications

### 3. Tool Implementation
- Verify all 29 tools are correctly implemented
- Check tool_definition schemas are complete
- Validate execute() method signatures
- Ensure proxy tools don't simulate intelligence

### 4. Integration Points
- Server initialization and tool registration
- MCP protocol handling (tools/list, tools/call)
- Environment variable handling
- Path resolution for scripts

### 5. Documentation
- README completeness and accuracy
- Design document alignment with implementation
- Code comments where necessary

Provide a detailed review with:
- Critical issues that must be fixed
- Improvements for code quality
- Security recommendations
- Performance optimizations
- Documentation gaps
